column1: Art Institute of Chicago////One serious issue I had is that it's not easy if you're handicapped or physically weak to visit this museum. I had badly sprained my knee before my trip and needed to take frequent breaks at the galleries
column2: but there weren't enough benches available. When we wanted to check out another exhibit and it wasn't connected to the main building
column4: walking through entire sections of another building
column6: before finally getting there. The elevators are around
column7: but really they should have some ramps instead of all these stairs. And they need a lot more benches. The dioramas had none and if you sit on the steps
column8: security comes and tells you to stand up or sit outside.
